prompt: Sell NMIMS like it's bottled bathwater — premium, mysterious, and 'good for skin'.
Pitch a hostel fan as a luxury sleep solution for CEOs.
Rebrand canteen chai as 'Liquid Confidence' for startup founders.
Convince people that standing in long queues is a networking opportunity.
Launch a fashion line inspired by college lost-and-found items.
Sell a pen that 'writes better answers during vivas.'
Market attendance as the next crypto investment.
Create a dating app that only matches people who've failed the same exam.
Pitch a gym membership where people only go to click mirror selfies.
Rebrand power cuts as 'digital detox therapy'.
Convince Gen Z to use landline phones 'for aesthetic productivity'.
Sell a pillow as the ultimate 'classroom learning assistant'.
Launch a startup that rents out fake friends for group projects.
Market college washrooms as the best place for life decisions.
Convince students that 8 AM lectures are the new morning party.
Design a product that gives motivational quotes when you open your wallet.
Sell boredom as a feature, not a bug — call it 'brain buffering'.
Launch a self-help book titled: "How to Survive Group Projects Without Actually Doing Anything".
Rebrand stress as a productivity booster — 'Now with extra anxiety!'
Create a campus tour that ends at the placement office... and loops forever.
